intro: Stapfiophyton erectum, commonly known as the erect stapfia, is a rare and striking member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. Stapfiophyton erectum is prized by horticulturists for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
